Class Logic

java.lang.Object
Logic
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Logic extends Object implements Serializable
This class represents the logic of the checkers game
Author:
edoar
See Also:

      public Square getSquare(int i, int j) throws Exception
      Getter of the square, if the square is not valid it throws an exception
      Parameters:
      i - the y_coordinate of the square to get
      j - the x_coordinate of the square to get
      Returns:
      the square which has cordinates i and j
      Throws:
      Exception - if the cordinates are not valid

      Checks if the current player can eat any piece
      Returns:

    • canEat

      private boolean canEat(int start_i, int start_j, int toEat_i, int toEat_j, int end_i, int end_j)
      Checks if a piece can eat another piece
      Parameters:
      start_i - the y_coordinate of the eater piece
      start_j - the x_coordinate of the eater piece
      toEat_i - the y_coordinate of the piece to eat
      toEat_j - the x_coordinate of the piece to eat
      end_i - the y_coordinate of the square where the piece should go after it has eaten the piece
      end_j - the x_coordinate of the square where the piece should go after it has eaten the piece
      Returns:
      true if the piece can it | false if the piece can't eat

    • canMoveAny

      private boolean canMoveAny()
      Checks if the current player can move any piece
      Returns:
      true if the player can move any piece | false if the palyer can't move any piece

    • canMove

      private boolean canMove(int start_i, int start_j, int end_i, int end_j)
      Checks if a piece can eat another piece
      Parameters:
      start_i - the y_coordinate of the moving piece
      start_j - the x_coordinate of the moving piece
      end_i - the y_coordinate of the square where the piece move
      end_j - the x_coordinate of the square where the piece move
      Returns:
      true if the piece can it | false if the piece can't eat

    • isOwnPiece

      private boolean isOwnPiece(int i, int j)
      Checks if the player has selected his own piece
      Parameters:
      i - the y_coordinate of the piece
      j - the x_coordinate of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the piece belongs to the player | false if the piece doesn't belong to the player

    • checkLooser

      public int checkLooser()
      Checks if the player has lost the game
      Returns:
      1 if the no one has lost | 1 if white has lost | 2 if black has lost

    • isAnyMarked

      private boolean isAnyMarked()
      Checks if there is any marked square on the board
      Returns:
      true if there is any marked square on the board | false otherwise
